recipes.title: White Chili with Quick-Roasted Garlic
recipes.source_note: Food Network Magazine - Melissa D'Arabian

ingredients.item: kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry

instructions.text: Make the roasted garlic: Toss the 12 cloves garlic with the olive oil and 1 teaspoon water in a microwave-safe bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and microwave until soft, about 90 seconds. Let cool slightly, then peel.

Prepare the chili: Preheat the broiler. Cook the shallots in olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-low heat until caramelized, about 20 minutes. Meanwhile, place the chiles on a foil-lined broiler pan and broil until charred on all sides, turning about 8 minutes. Transfer to a bowl, cover with plastic wrap and let cool. Peel the peppers.

Add the minced garlic to the shallots and cook until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Add the flour and cook, stirring, until lightly browned, about 3 minutes. Add the wine and stir with your fingers or a paring knife. Stir, then add the roasted garlic and chiles. Increase the heat to high and add the chicken broth; cook until slightly thickened.

Meanwhile, squeeze the soft pulp from the roasted garlic into a blender. Add the chile and the spinach and process until smooth. Add to the chili and stir. Add the beans, shredded chicken and chili powder. Simmer 30 minutes, adding cream at the end. Garnish with cheese.

flags: image rotated, some text difficult to read

recipes.title: Almost-Famous Broccoli-Cheddar Soup
recipes.source_note: Food Network Magazine - Panera Bread copycat

ingredients.item: kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
grated sharp white and yellow cheddar cheese, plus more for garnish

instructions.text: Melt the butter in a large Dutch oven or pot over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Whisk in the flour and cook until golden, 3 to 4 minutes, then gradually whisk in the half-and-half until smooth. Add the chicken broth, bay leaves and nutmeg, then season with salt and pepper and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to medium-low and cook, uncovered, until thickened, about 20 minutes.

Meanwhile, prepare the bread bowls: Using a sharp knife, cut a circle into the top of each loaf, leaving a 1-inch border all around. Remove the bread top, then hollow out the middle with a fork or your fingers, leaving a thick bread shell.

Add the broccoli and carrot to the broth mixture and simmer until tender, about 20 minutes. Discard the bay leaves. Puree the soup in batches in a blender until smooth; you'll still have flecks of carrot and broccoli. Return to the pot. (Or puree the soup in the pot with an immersion blender.)
Add the cheese to the soup and whisk over medium heat until melted. Add up to 3/4 cup water if the soup is too thick. Ladle into the bread bowls and garnish with cheese.

notes: Panera Bread sells over 50 million cups of this soup annually.
Or puree the soup in the pot with an immersion blender.
Add up to 3/4 cup water if the soup is too thick.

recipes.title: Aaron McCargo Jr.'s Steak Fajita Chili
recipes.source_note: Food Network Magazine January/February 2010

ingredients.item: kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
red or green bell pepper, chopped

instructions.text: Heat 1/4 cup canola oil in a large soup pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Season the short ribs with salt and pepper and sear until golden brown, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Transfer the meat to another large pot (set the first pot aside) and add the broth. Cover and cook until tender, about 1 hour 30 minutes.

Meanwhile, heat the remaining 1 cup oil in the reserved pot over medium heat. Add the onion, bell pepper, and cumin, chili powder, oregano, flour. Cook, stirring, until the flour is lightly browned and set aside until the meat is done. Add the warm broth and whisk until smooth; cover the broth and set aside.

Transfer the short ribs to a cutting board; cover the broth and set aside. Let the meat cool slightly, then cut into chunks. Place the pot with the vegetables over medium-high heat. Slowly add the warm broth and whisk until smooth. Stir in the chopped short ribs and the beans, bring to a simmer and cook until thickened, about 15 minutes. Ladle into bowls and garnish with guacamole, sour cream, cheese and fried tortilla strips, for a little extra crunch.

notes: Aaron's secret weapon: Short ribs for extra richness.
Ladle into bowls and garnish with guacamole, sour cream, cheese and fried tortilla strips for a little extra crunch.

recipes.title: Tortilla Soup
recipes.source_note: Food Network Magazine - Taco Bell copycat

ingredients.item: diced tomatoes, with dried oregano and salt

instructions.text: Sauté the diced onion, minced jalapeño and garlic cloves in canola oil in a large pot. Add the ground cumin.
Add the low-sodium chicken broth and two 15-ounce cans no-salt canned vegetables.
Stir in lime juice. Meanwhile, toast the tortilla in a 350°F oven until crisp.
Ladle into bowls, garnish with sour cream and some chopped cilantro on top. Crumble the toasted tortilla on top.

recipes.title: Anasazi and Black Bean Chili
recipes.source_note: Cooking Light - Food Trends by Michael Ruhlman
recipes.description: Slightly sweet red-and-white Anasazi beans contrast with robust black beans in flavor and color. You can substitute pinto beans for the Anasazi beans if you prefer.

instructions.text: Sort and wash Anasazi beans; place in a large bowl. Cover with water to 2 inches above beans. Cover and let stand 8 hours. Drain and set aside.
Place Anasazi beans in a large saucepan; cover with water to 2 inches above. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat, and simmer 50 minutes or until tender. Drain.
Repeat procedure with black beans.
Heat a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Coat pan with cooking spray. Add onion and next 5 ingredients (through garlic); sauté 5 minutes.

Add ingredients: Add beans, broth, and next 5 ingredients (through tomatoes); bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 35 minutes. Stir in chorizo; simmer 5 minutes. Serve with sour cream and chopped onion, if desired. Yield: 8 servings.

recipes.title: Creamy Carrot Soup
recipes.source_note: Cooking Light Reader Recipe by Lisa Richardson, Glendale, Calif.
recipes.description: I prepared this soup for my parents, who watch my daughter one afternoon a week. They absolutely loved its velvety sweetness. Garnish with shredded carrot and fresh mint.

ingredients.item: chopped Vidalia or other sweet onion

instructions.text: Heat oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Add onion and carrots to pan; cook 10 minutes, stirring frequently. Stir in salt, pepper, and ginger.
Add 2 cups water and broth to pan; bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 25 minutes or until carrots are tender. Remove from heat; cool.

Place half of carrot mixture and 1 tablespoon cream in a food processor or blender; process 20 seconds or until smooth. Pour pureed mixture into a large bowl. Repeat procedure with remaining carrot mixture and 1 tablespoon cream. Return mixture to pan; cook over medium heat until thoroughly heated. Yield: 4 servings.

notes: CALORIES 180; FAT 6.9g (sat 2.3g, mono 3.3g, poly 0.9g); PROTEIN 3.5g; CARB 28.7g; FIBER 7.6g; CHOL 10mg; IRON 0.9mg; SODIUM 963mg; CALC 97mg

recipes.title: Broccoli and Chicken Noodle Soup
recipes.source_note: Cooking Light - Lighten Up by Kathy Kitchens Downie, RD
recipes.description: If the broccoli florets are large, break into smaller pieces at the stalk instead of chopping them; they'll cook more quickly. Count on having dinner on the table in about 40 minutes, and serve this soup the moment it's done for the best results. In fact, if you wait, you'll find it gets thicker with time. If you have leftovers, you will want to thin the soup with a little chicken broth or milk to the desired consistency.

ingredients.item: shredded light processed cheese (such as Velveeta Light)

instructions.text: Heat a Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Coat pan with cooking spray. Add onion, mushrooms, and garlic to pan; sauté 5 minutes or until liquid evaporates, stirring occasionally. Reduce heat to medium; add butter to mushroom mixture, stirring until butter melts. Sprinkle mushroom mixture with flour; cook 2 minutes, stirring occasionally. Gradually add milk and broth, stirring constantly with a whisk; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low; cook 10 minutes or until slightly thick, stirring constantly.

Add pasta to pan; cook 10 minutes. Add cheese to pan, and stir until cheese melts. Add chicken and remaining ingredients to pan; cook 5 minutes or until broccoli is tender and soup is thoroughly heated. Yield: 10 servings.

notes: Before: CALORIES 534, TOTAL FAT 33g, SATURATED FAT 18.6g, SODIUM 1,289mg
After: CALORIES 317, TOTAL FAT 12.3g, SATURATED FAT 6.8g, SODIUM 723mg
If the broccoli florets are large, break into smaller pieces at the stalk instead of chopping them; they'll cook more quickly.
Count on having dinner on the table in about 40 minutes.
Serve this soup the moment it's done for the best results. In fact, if you wait, you'll find it gets thicker with time.
If you have leftovers, you will want to thin the soup with a little chicken broth or milk to the desired consistency.

recipes.title: Albondigas Soup
recipes.source_note: Cooking Light Magazine - Reader Recipes

ingredients.item: bag frozen pepper stir-fry (such as Birds Eye)
boneless chicken breast, trimmed and cut into 3/4-inch pieces

instructions.text: Heat oil in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add pepper stir-fry to pan; sauté 5 minutes. Add carrots; sauté, stirring occasionally. Add broth, chiles, and tomatoes; bring to a boil. Reduce heat, and simmer 15 minutes or until carrots are tender, stirring occasionally.

Place one-third of broth mixture in blender (let allow steam to escape); process until smooth. Return to pan. Add remaining broth mixture; bring to a boil. Drop by rounded tablespoon into broth mixture. Add remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper. Stir in juice and remaining 1/4 cup cilantro. Serve immediately. Yield: 12 servings (serving size: about 1 1/3 cups).

notes: CALORIES 136; FAT 4.7g (sat 1.2g, mono 2.0g, poly 0.8g); PROTEIN 20.2g; CARB 4.2g; FIBER 0.8g; CHOL 59mg; IRON 1.4mg; SODIUM 796mg; CALC 29mg

recipes.title: Easy Creamy Broccoli Soup
recipes.source_note: Cooking Light Magazine March 2009 - Country Crock Advertisement
recipes.description: A family-friendly favorite with Calcium and Vitamin D from Shedd's Spread Country Crock.

ingredients.item: Shedd's Spread Country Crock Calcium plus Vitamin D

instructions.text: Melt Shedd's Spread Country Crock Calcium plus Vitamin D in 4-quart saucepot and cook onion, stirring occasionally, 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in broth and milk. Bring to a boil over high heat. Add broccoli. Reduce heat to low and simmer 5 minutes or until broccoli is tender.

Process soup, in batches, in blender until smooth. Return soup to saucepot. Season with pepper and heat through. Remove from heat; then stir in cheese until melted. Garnish, if desired, with additional cheese.

notes: CALORIES 150; Calories from Fat 80; Saturated Fat 4.5g; Trans Fat 0g; Cholesterol 20mg; Sodium 470mg; Total Carbohydrate 9g; Sugars 4g; Dietary Fiber 2g; Protein 8g; Vitamin A 10%; Vitamin C 45%; Calcium 25%; Iron 0%
Mix it up! Not in the mood for plain potatoes? This recipe is a great base for your favorite creative add-ins. Try stirring in some roasted garlic, Parmesan cheese, chives, or crumbled bacon.

recipes.title: Black Bean Soup
recipes.source_note: Cooking Light Magazine March 2009 - Slow Cooker
recipes.description: Cumin and fiery serrano chile infuse this simple soup as it cooks, and a dollop of sour cream provides a refreshing foil for the spicy flavors. For less heat, seed the chile first or use a milder pepper, such as jalapeño. You can also omit the chile altogether, if you prefer.

instructions.text: Sort and wash beans; place in a large bowl. Cover with water to 2 inches above beans; cover and let stand 8 hours. Drain.

Combine beans, broth, and next 5 ingredients (through chile) in an electric slow cooker. Cover and cook on LOW 10 hours. Discard bay leaves. Stir in juice and salt. Ladle 1 1/3 cups soup into each of 6 bowls; sprinkle each with 2 teaspoons chopped cilantro. Top each serving with 1 1/2 teaspoons sour cream. Garnish with cilantro sprigs, if desired. Yield: 6 servings.

notes: CALORIES 288; FAT 2.3g (sat 0.9g, mono 0.4g, poly 0.5g); PROTEIN 18.5g; CARB 50g; FIBER 17.5g; CHOL 2.9mg; IRON 4.6mg; SODIUM 581mg; CALC 87mg
Wine note: With jammy fruit and light tannins, zinfandel makes a great wine for cooking.

recipes.title: Borlotti Minestrone
recipes.source_note: Cooking Light Magazine March 2009 - Heirloom Beans Feature
recipes.servings_yield: 8 servings (serving size: 1 1/4 cups soup and 1 tablespoon cheese)
recipes.description: Borlotti beans—the Italian variety of cranberry beans—can be ordered from www.ranchogordo.com, among other online retailers. Why are time-honored varieties of beans finding fresh favor in home kitchens? 'I think heirloom beans taste better,' says Steve Sando, whose Rancho Gordo in Napa, California, grows and sells nearly 30 varieties of distinctive beans. 'Runner beans tend to be buttery. Christmas limas have a distinct chestnut taste, and the bean broth is beefy. Some types are like potatoes in texture; others are creamy.'

instructions.text: Sort and wash beans; place in a large bowl. Cover with water to 2 inches above beans; cover and let stand 8 hours or overnight. Drain beans.
Place beans in a large saucepan, and cover with water to 3 inches above beans; bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer 1 1/2 hours or until tender. Drain.

Heat a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add bacon to pan; cook 6 minutes or until crisp, stirring frequently. Add onion and next 5 ingredients (through garlic); sauté 4 minutes. Add zucchini; sauté 3 minutes. Add kale; sauté 2 minutes or until kale wilts. Add 3 cups water, tomato paste, broth, and tomatoes; bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 30 minutes. Add beans; simmer, uncovered, 30 minutes. Stir in salt and pepper; sprinkle with cheese. Yield: 8 servings (serving size: 1 1/4 cups soup and 1 tablespoon cheese).

notes: CALORIES 224; FAT 5.7g (sat 2.4g, mono 2.1g, poly 0.7g); PROTEIN 14.9g; CARB 31.6g; FIBER 10.7g; CHOL 12mg; IRON 3mg; SODIUM 662mg; CALC 199mg
For another heirloom bean recipe, see Anasazi and Black Bean Chili, page 167.
Borlotti beans—the Italian variety of cranberry beans—can be ordered from www.ranchogordo.com, among other online retailers.
Runner beans tend to be buttery. Christmas limas have a distinct chestnut taste, and the bean broth is beefy.
They've been saved from extinction because they taste good.

recipes.title: Barley and Beef Soup
recipes.source_note: Cooking Light Magazine March 2009 - Lunch Feature
recipes.description: Make this soup the night before to allow time for its flavors to develop. Pour hot servings into a thermos to take for lunch, or reheat individual portions in the microwave as needed. Serve the soup with crusty bread, crackers, or Spicy Whole-Wheat Pita Chips (page 90).

ingredients.item: chuck steak, trimmed and cut into 1/2-inch cubes

instructions.text: Heat a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Coat pan with cooking spray. Add chopped onion and beef to pan; cook 10 minutes or until onion is tender and beef is browned, stirring occasionally. Add chopped carrot and chopped celery to pan; cook 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in garlic; cook 30 seconds. Stir in barley and remaining ingredients, and bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 40 minutes or until the barley is done and vegetables are tender. Discard bay leaves. Yield: 6 servings (serving size: about 1 1/4 cups).

notes: CALORIES 275; FAT 5g (sat 1.6g, mono 2.3g, poly 0.3g); PROTEIN 21.8g; CARB 36g; FIBER 8g; CHOL 43mg; IRON 3.1mg; SODIUM 649mg; CALC 57mg

Make dishes ahead when possible. Barley and Beef Soup (above), like many soups and stews, improves with time; make it the night before. Lemony Hummus (page 90), too, will grow better as its ingredients marry.
Make this soup the night before to allow time for its flavors to develop.
Pour hot servings into a thermos to take for lunch, or reheat individual portions in the microwave as needed.
Serve the soup with crusty bread, crackers, or Spicy Whole-Wheat Pita Chips.
Make dishes ahead when possible—like many soups and stews, this improves with time.
Keep it separate: To prevent soggy sandwiches, pack separate zip-top bags of tomato slices, lettuce, and bread, then assemble just before serving.
Don't dress leafy salads until you are ready to eat. Salt will draw moisture out of watery ingredients.
Put leftovers to good use. Consider applying extras from dinner to the next day's lunch.
Stay safe: Keep cold food cold (below 40°) and hot food hot (above 140°) as it travels.
Use insulated lunch bags, coolers, thermoses, ice bags, and frozen gel packs.
If re-heating items in a microwave, the USDA recommends they reach 165° and are served steaming hot.

recipes.title: Chipotle Black Bean Soup
recipes.source_note: Goya Advertisement

ingredients.item: chipotle, plus 2 tsp sauce from 1 can (7 oz) GOYA Chipotle Chiles in Adobo Sauce
GOYA Chicken Bouillon mixed with 2 cups water
green bell pepper, or 4 cloves garlic, chopped

instructions.text: In bowl of blender, add 1 can black beans, chipotle and bouillon mixture. Puree until smooth, about 30 seconds; set aside.

Heat oil in large pot over medium-high heat. Add onions and peppers; cook until soft, about 10 minutes. Add garlic and cumin; cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds more. Add reserved black bean puree and remaining black beans. Add mixture to a boil; reduce heat to medium-low and cook, stirring occasionally, until soup thickens and flavors come together, about 10 minutes.
Divide soup evenly among serving bowls. Top with a dollop of sour cream. Sprinkle with tomatoes and cilantro.

recipes.title: Dumpling Soup
recipes.source_note: Food Network Magazine December 2010

ingredients.item: dry sherry or Chinese rice wine
kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
scallions, sliced, white and green parts separated
frozen chicken or vegetable dumplings or pot stickers

instructions.text: Combine 2 cups water, the broth, ham, sherry, sugar, ginger, orange zest, ½ teaspoon salt, and pepper to taste in a large pot. Cover and bring to a boil over high heat. Add the scallion whites, mushrooms and carrots. Reduce the heat and simmer, uncovered, until the carrots are crisp-tender, about 4 minutes.

Add the cabbage, dumplings and scallion greens. Cover and cook until the dumplings are soft and heated through, 4 to 5 minutes. Divide the dumplings and soup among bowls. Drizzle with soy sauce, if desired.

recipes.title: Simple Shrimp Gumbo
recipes.source_note: Kindle cookbook screenshot (Page 9 of 37)
recipes.description: Cajun-style shrimp gumbo with a dark roux and vegetables.

instructions.text: Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Sprinkle the flour into the skillet and stir it constantly until the flour has browned. Turn off the heat.
Transfer the oil and flour (the roux) to a large soup pot.
Pour the chicken broth into the soup pot and bring it to a boil. Lower heat and stir well.
Add in the celery, bell pepper, onion, tomatoes, salt, pepper, thyme, bay leaves, and Cajun seasoning.
Let everything simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add in the liquid smoke and shrimp and cook for 3-5 minutes, or until shrimp begins to turn pink.
Serve over rice.

notes: Transfer the oil and flour mixture (the roux) to a large soup pot.
Serve over rice.

recipes.title: Corn Soup
recipes.source_note: Kindle cookbook screenshot (Page 11 of 37)
recipes.description: Creamy corn soup with fresh corn and Greek yogurt.

instructions.text: Cut the corn from the cob and set corn aside.
Heat the oil in a soup pot over medium heat and sauté the onion for 3-4 minutes.
Add the chicken stock and bring it to a boil then reduce the heat to a simmer.
Add the corn, creamed corn, cumin, and salt. Simmer for 15 minutes.
Stir in the green onion and plain Greek yogurt. Stir well and simmer for 10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.

notes: Season with salt and pepper before serving.

recipes.title: Chicken Tortilla Soup
recipes.source_note: Kindle cookbook screenshot (Page 12 of 37)
recipes.description: Mexican-style chicken soup with tomatoes, salsa, and fresh cilantro.

instructions.text: Heat olive oil in a large soup pot over medium-high heat.
Add the garlic into the pot and sauté for a couple of minutes.
Add the chicken pieces to the pot and cook until completely done.
Add the diced tomatoes, Rotel tomatoes, salsa, and ground cumin. Let simmer for 5 minutes.
Add in the chicken broth and let simmer for 20 minutes.
Before serving stir in the cilantro, salt, and pepper.

recipes.title: Taco Soup
recipes.source_note: Kindle cookbook screenshot (Page 25 of 37)
recipes.description: Hearty Tex-Mex soup with ground beef, beans, corn, and taco seasoning.

instructions.text: Brown the ground beef in a large pot and drain.
Add in the rest of the ingredients and cook over medium heat for 15 minutes.
Serve with Fritos and cheese.

recipes.title: Lebanese Lemon Lentil Soup
recipes.description: A hearty lentil soup with vegetables, warm spices, and a creamy flour-butter roux finish.

instructions.text: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Stir fry vegetables for 5 minutes, add garlic and cook 30 seconds.
Add water, spices, lentils, and parsley. Cover and simmer for 1.5 hours.
Make roux: whisk flour and butter over medium-low heat for 10 minutes until paste forms, then cook until brown (20 min).
Whisk brown paste into soup spoonful by spoonful. Serve with lemon wedges and parsley.

recipes.source_note: Lebanese Recipes digital cookbook

recipes.title: Lebanese Red Lentil Soup
recipes.description: A smooth, pureed red lentil soup with cumin, cayenne, cilantro, and fresh lemon.

instructions.text: Simmer lentils in stock for 20 minutes. Fry onions and garlic in olive oil.
Combine and add spices, cook 10 more minutes. Puree, add lemon and cilantro.

recipes.source_note: Lebanese Recipes digital cookbook

recipes.title: Chard Lentil Soup
recipes.description: A Lebanese-style soup with brown lentils, Swiss chard, potatoes, and a lemon-garlic finish.

instructions.text: Boil lentils 10 min, add chard 5 min, add potatoes and cook 12 min.
Add lemon-garlic-salt mixture, simmer 5 min. Add oil, heat 2 min on high.

recipes.source_note: Lebanese Recipes digital cookbook

recipes.title: Adas bil Hamod
recipes.description: A Lebanese lentil soup with spinach, caramelized onions, and lemon.

instructions.text: Caramelize onions in oil 10-15 min. Add lentils, spinach, garlic, mint and water.
Boil then simmer 20 min. Add salt and lemon juice.

recipes.source_note: Lebanese Recipes digital cookbook

recipes.title: Lentil Lemon Soup II
recipes.description: A hearty Lebanese lentil soup with Swiss chard, made with a homemade herb broth.

instructions.text: Make broth: simmer chicken broth, 6 cups water, herbs, bay leaf, small onion for 1.5 hrs. Strain.
Cook lentils in broth + 4 cups water for 1 hr. Fry onion and garlic in oil, add chard.
Combine chard mixture with lentils, add cilantro and lemon juice, simmer 15 min.

recipes.source_note: Lebanese Recipes digital cookbook

recipes.title: Italian Veggie Beef Soup
recipes.description: A hearty Italian-seasoned soup loaded with ground beef, cabbage, and mixed vegetables in a rich tomato-beef broth.

instructions.text: In a 6-qt. stockpot, cook ground beef and onions over medium-high heat until beef is no longer pink, 6-8 minutes, breaking up beef into crumbles; drain.
Add cabbage, mixed vegetables, tomatoes, seasonings and broth; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, until cabbage is crisp-tender, 10-15 minutes. Remove bay leaf.

notes: Diabetic Exchanges: 2 lean meat, 1 vegetable, 1/2 starch.
Makes a large batch - great for meal prep or freezing.

recipes.title: Beef Black Bean Soup
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home recipe collection - slow cooker
recipes.description: A hearty slow cooker soup with ground beef, black beans, and rice. The corn, tomatoes, and green chilies give it a southwestern flair.

instructions.text: In a nonstick skillet, cook beef over medium heat until no longer pink; drain.
Stir in 1 teaspoon garlic powder.
Transfer to a 5-qt. slow cooker.
Add the broth, beans, tomatoes, corn, chilies, and remaining garlic powder.
Cover and cook on high for 1 hour.
Reduce heat to low; cook 4-5 hours longer or until flavors are blended.
Just before serving, stir in rice and heat through.

notes: Freezer-friendly recipe.
If you want to freeze and reheat, consider leaving out the rice and adding it when reheating.
Prep ahead: Cook the beef the night before and refrigerate.

recipes.title: Beef Barley Lentil Soup
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home recipe collection
recipes.description: I serve this soup often to family and friends on cold nights, along with homemade rolls and a green salad. For variety, you can substitute jicama for the potatoes.

ingredients.item: 2 cans (14-1/2 ounces each) stewed tomatoes, coarsely chopped

instructions.text: In a nonstick skillet, cook beef and onion over medium heat until meat is no longer pink, 6-8 minutes, breaking up beef into crumbles; drain.

Transfer to a 5-qt. slow cooker. Layer with potatoes, celery, carrots, lentils and barley. Combine water, bouillon and lemon pepper; pour over vegetables. Cover and cook on low for 6 hours or until vegetables and barley are tender.
Add tomatoes and salt; cook 2 hours longer.

recipes.title: Beef Lentil Soup
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home recipe collection
recipes.description: This beef lentil soup combines tender ground beef, nutritious lentils, and fresh vegetables in a hearty broth, making it a comforting one-pot meal all year long.

ingredients.item: 1 can (46 ounces) tomato or V8 juice
1 package (10 ounces) frozen chopped spinach, thawed

instructions.text: In a large stockpot, cook beef over medium heat until no longer pink, 5-7 minutes; crumble meat; drain. Add the tomato juice, water, lentils, cabbage, carrots, celery, onion, green pepper, pepper, thyme and bay leaf.
Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, for 1 to 1-1/2 hours or until the lentils and vegetables are tender. Add spinach and heat through. Remove bay leaf.

recipes.title: Couscous Meatball Soup
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home recipe collection
recipes.description: This soup will warm you up and takes just 25 minutes of prep time, making it a perfect weeknight meal. &mdash;Jonathan Pace, San Francisco, California

instructions.text: In a small bowl, combine the beef, basil, oregano and salt, mixing lightly but thoroughly. Shape into 1/2-in. balls. In a large skillet coated with cooking spray, brown meatballs; drain. Remove meatballs and set aside.
In the same skillet, brown onion in oil. Add greens and kale; cook 6-7 minutes longer or until wilted.

In a Dutch oven, combine the greens mixture, meatballs, stock, vinegar, pepper flakes and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Return to a boil. Stir in couscous. Reduce heat; cover and simmer, stirring once, until couscous is tender, 10-15 minutes.

recipes.title: Beef Mushroom Soup
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: Leftover roast beef gives this beef mushroom soup recipe an all-day-simmered taste in a weeknight-friendly timeframe.

instructions.text: In a large saucepan, saute the onion and mushrooms in butter until the onion is tender. Remove them with a slotted spoon and set them aside.
In a small bowl, whisk together the flour and broth until smooth. Then, gradually add the mixture to the pan. Bring them to a boil. Cook and stir until it's thickened, one to two minutes.
Add the roast beef, garlic powder, paprika, pepper, salt, pepper sauce and onion mixture. Cook and stir until they're heated through.
Serve the soup, garnished with cheese, if desired.

recipes.title: Butternut Squash and Carrot Soup
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: I got this golden soup recipe from a friend. Sometimes I add a few slices of red pepper to change up the flavor a bit.

ingredients.item: 1 small butternut squash (about 2 pounds), peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes (about 5 cups)

instructions.text: In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat; saute onion, garlic and ginger until tender, 4-5 minutes. Transfer to a 5-qt. slow cooker.
Add all remaining ingredients except cream and green onions. Cook, covered, on low until vegetables are soft, 7-9 hours.
Puree soup using an immersion blender, or cool slightly and, in batches, puree in a blender and return to slow cooker. Stir in cream; heat through. If desired, top with green onions.

recipes.title: Cream of Asparagus Soup
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: We have a large asparagus patch and are able to freeze a lot for the year. My recipe highlights the flavor of the vegetable and is very easy to make.

ingredients.item: 2 pounds fresh asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces (about 5 cups)

instructions.text: Heat the canola oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add in the onion and cook for four to six minutes, until tender, stirring consistently. Add the garlic and cook for another minute. Then add the asparagus and chicken broth, and bring everything to a boil. Reduce the heat and let the mixture simmer uncovered for 8 to 10 minutes, until the asparagus is tender.

Remove the vegetable-broth mix from the heat and let it cool slightly. Transfer everything to a blender and blend until smooth. If you have an immersion blender, you could also blend right in the pot.

In a small bowl, whisk together 2 tablespoons of the flour and 1/4 cup of the milk until the mixture is smooth, then set it aside. In a large saucepan, heat the butter over medium heat. Stir in the seasonings and the remaining flour until everything is smooth. Cook for 45 to 60 seconds or until everything is lightly golden brown. Then gradually add in the cream, the rest of the milk and the reserved flour mixture. Bring everything to a boil, stirring constantly, and cook for one to two minutes, until thickened.
Stir in the white wine, lemon juice and blended asparagus mixture. Heat everything thoroughly, then transfer to bowls. Top with chives before serving, if desired.

recipes.title: Greens and Beans Turkey Soup
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: On winter evenings, we like nothing better than a piping hot bowl of soup. This one uses the turkey carcass to make a flavorful stock for the soup.

ingredients.item: 1 can (15-1/2 ounces) great northern beans, rinsed and drained
1 package (10 ounces) frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry

instructions.text: Place turkey carcass in a stockpot; add water, celery and onion. Slowly bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer, covered, 2 hours.

Remove carcass and cool. Strain broth through a cheesecloth-lined colander; discard vegetables. Skim fat. Remove meat from bones and cut into bite-sized pieces; discard bones. Return broth and meat to pot.
Add beans, spinach, chopped onion, bouillon, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer, covered, 10 minutes.

recipes.title: Italian Vegetable Beef Soup
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: Ground meat, veggies and broth come together in a snap in this recipe for Italian vegetable beef soup, which can be customized endlessly to use whatever ingredients you've got.

instructions.text: In a 6-qt. stockpot, cook the ground beef and onions over medium-high heat until the beef is no longer pink, six to eight minutes, breaking beef into crumbles as it cooks. Drain if desired. Editor's Tip: Feel free to skip the draining step if you prefer. The fat in the pan will be full of flavor from the beef and onions, and you'll lose that flavor if you toss it.

Add the cabbage, mixed vegetables, tomatoes, seasonings and broth, and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer, uncovered, until the cabbage is crisp-tender, 10 to 15 minutes. Remove the bay leaf and serve.

recipes.title: Pressure-Cooker Mexican Beef Soup
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: My family loves this stew, and I'm happy to make it since it's so simple! Serve the dish with cornbread to make the meal even more filling.

ingredients.item: 3/4 pound potatoes (about 2 medium), cut into 3/4-inch cubes
1 can (10 ounces) diced tomatoes and green chiles
Optional: Sour cream and tortilla chips

instructions.text: In a 6-qt. electric pressure cooker, combine first 12 ingredients. Lock lid; close pressure-release valve. Adjust to pressure-cook on high for 15 minutes. Allow pressure to naturally release for 10 minutes, then quick-release any remaining pressure.
If desired, serve with sour cream and chips.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Curry Soup
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: This pumpkin curry soup infuses warm spices and hearty vegetables into the squash base, making it a delicious recipe to add to your comfort food rotation.

instructions.text: Heat a large saucepan over medium heat. Melt the butter, then add the sliced mushrooms and onions and cook until they are tender.
Sprinkle the flour and curry powder in the saucepan. Cook the flour until it turns golden brown, one to two minutes.
Gradually add the vegetable broth in small increments while stirring, then bring the mixture to a boil, cooking and stirring until thickened, about two minutes.
Add the pumpkin, evaporated milk, honey, salt, pepper and nutmeg. Stir well and heat through, cooking until the soup is smooth. Garnish with chives and serve.

recipes.title: Beef Barley Soup
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: This hearty beef barley soup uses a simple blend of mirepoix, broth and steak to make a filling soup with basic ingredients.

ingredients.item: 1 pound beef top round steak, cut into 1/2-inch cubes

instructions.text: In a large saucepan, heat the oil over medium heat. Brown beef on all sides. Drain excess liquid before continuing. Editor's Tip: Browning the beef adds a caramelized flavor to the whole pot of soup. If you want to use mirepoix instead of adding the chopped veggies later, simmer the carrots, onion and celery during this step too.
Stir in the broth, water, barley, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for one hour.
Add the carrots, celery, onion and parsley. Cover and simmer until the meat and vegetables are tender, 30 to 40 minutes. Stir in the peas and simmer until heated through.

recipes.title: Navy Bean Soup
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: When comfort food calls, make this hearty navy bean soup. It's soul-warming and filling, a perfect way to use up leftover ham.

ingredients.item: 1 meaty ham hock or 1 cup diced cooked ham

instructions.text: Sort through your navy beans, removing any dirt, cracked beans or rocks. Rinse the beans thoroughly, and soak them according to package directions.

Drain and rinse the beans, discarding the liquid. Place the beans in a Dutch oven. Add the tomatoes with their juice, onion, ham hock, broth, water, salt and pepper. Stir well, and bring everything to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer. Cover and cook until beans are tender, about 1 hour and 30 minutes.

If you used a ham hock, remove it from the pot, and let it stand until cool enough to handle. Remove the meat from the bone, and discard the bone. Cut the ham into bite-sized pieces, and set aside. If the soup has thickened up too much, add more water until it's the consistency you'd like. If you want a thicker soup, let the soup cool slightly, then puree some of the beans in a food processor or blender, and return to pan. Add the ham back to the soup, and heat through while stirring often. Garnish with parsley if desired, and serve.

recipes.title: Split Pea Soup
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: This split pea soup is hearty and soul-warming, just the thing for a cold day.

ingredients.item: 1 package (16 ounces) dried green split peas

instructions.text: Sort through the split peas, checking for pebbles or other dirt, then rinse them thoroughly with cold water. Place the peas in a Dutch oven, and add enough water to cover them by 2 inches. Bring the water to a boil, and boil for two minutes. Remove the pot from heat. Cover and let the peas stand in the water for one to four hours or until the peas are softened. Drain and rinse the peas, discarding the liquid.

Return the peas to the Dutch oven. Add 2-1/2 quarts water, the ham bone, onion, salt, pepper, thyme and bay leaf. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer, and cover. Allow to cook for 1 hour and 30 minutes, stirring occasionally so the bottom doesn't burn.

Remove the ham bone from the soup. When it's cool enough to handle, remove as much meat from the bone as possible. Dice the meat, and return it to the soup, adding the carrot and celery as well. Simmer, uncovered, for 45 to 60 minutes, stirring often, until the soup reaches desired thickness and the vegetables are tender. Discard the bay leaf, and serve.

recipes.title: Slow-Cooker Split Pea Soup
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Friendly
recipes.description: Slow-cooker split pea soup is so easy, all you have to do is dump everything into the cooker. This soul-warming soup comes together in a snap!

ingredients.item: 1 package (16 ounces) dried green split peas, rinsed

instructions.text: Place the split peas, ham, onion, carrots, garlic, rosemary, thyme, chicken broth and water in a 4- or 5-quart slow cooker. Editor's Tip: These brands are our Test Kitchen's picks for the best slow cooker.

Cover the slow cooker, and cook on low for 8 to 10 hours, until the peas are tender. Editor's Tip: As the soup slow-cooks, stir it a few times to evenly distribute the ingredients and avoid any sticking or clumping inside the cooker insert.

recipes.title: Chicken Gnocchi Pesto Soup
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - World Cuisines
recipes.description: Chicken gnocchi pesto soup is rich and filling, yet takes less than 30 minutes to make. Get the crusty bread ready

ingredients.item: 1 jar (15 ounces) roasted garlic Alfredo sauce

instructions.text: Combine the chopped chicken with Alfredo sauce, Italian seasoning, salt, pepper and 2 cups of water in a large soup pot or Dutch oven. Bring them to a gentle boil, stirring occasionally.

Stir the potato gnocchi and fresh spinach into the soup. Cook the soup until the gnocchi float, about three to eight minutes. Editor's Tip: The rule of thumb is that gnocchi are ready to eat when they float to the top. Once this happens, spoon one out to test it; it should be cooked and warmed throughout. This may only take a few minutes with fresh gnocchi, so watch them closely to avoid overcooking. Frozen gnocchi should go straight into the soup to cook, and may take a minute or two longer.
Ladle the soup into bowls and top each serving with 1 teaspoon of pesto.

recipes.title: Easy Chipotle Cheddar Beef Chili
recipes.source_note: Half Baked Harvest - Mexican Recipes
recipes.description: My family's favorite quick and easy chili recipe - perfect for cold fall and winter nights - delicious, hearty chili!

ingredients.item: 2 pounds ground beef ((or use ground chicken or ground pork))
1 can (28 ounce)  crushed fire roasted tomatoes
2-3 tablespoons Gochujang chili paste, to your taste
cilantro, green onion, avocado and Greek yogurt, for serving

instructions.text: 1. In a large dutch oven set over medium-high heat, brown the meat and onions all over, breaking up the meat as you go, about 5 minutes.2. Add the poblanos, chili powder, chipotle powder, garlic powder, paprika, and cumin. Cook for 5 minutes, until fragrant. Mix in the tomatoes, tomato paste, Gochujang, butter, and diced chilies. Pour over 2 cups of broth. Add the tamari. Stir to combine. Partially cover and cook on low for 1-2 hours or up to all day, stirring every hour.3. Towards the end of cooking, stir in the cream cheese, cheddar cheese, and beans. Cook until the cheese melts, 5 minutes.4. Ladle the chili into bowls. Top, as desired. I like Greek yogurt/sour cream, cheese, avocado, cilantro, and green onions. Eat and enjoy!

recipes.title: Easy Chili Lime Chicken
recipes.source_note: Half Baked Harvest - Mexican Recipes
recipes.description: Serve to your family tonight, but don’t overlook this for a dinner party...simple to create, healthy, and looks pretty!

ingredients.item: 2 pounds small boneless chicken breasts or thighs
steamed rice and naan for serving

instructions.text: 1. Preheat the oven to 400°.2. In a baking dish, toss together the chicken, garlic, paprika, cumin, salt, and pepper. Arrange the butter slices over the chicken. Bake for 20-30 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through. 3. Meanwhile, make the sauce. In a sauce pot, warm 4 tablespoons butter or olive oil with onion powder, garlic powder, cayenne, and chipotle chili powder. Add the fresno pepper or chil flakes to taste. Cook over low heat until melted. Remove from the heat, whisk in the honey and lime juice. Add the cilantro. Season with salt.4. Spoon the sauce over the warm chicken. Serve the chicken and sauce over bowls of rice with fresh basil and additional sauce.

recipes.title: Honey Lime Chili Chicken Bowls
recipes.source_note: Half Baked Harvest - Mexican Recipes
recipes.description: These bowls are the simplest to make and come together in under 45 minutes...a fun family dinner!

ingredients.item: 1 1/2 pounds boneless chicken breasts or thighs
avocado, yogurt/sour cream + limes, for serving

instructions.text: 1. Preheat the oven to 425° F. 2. On a baking sheet, toss the chicken with olive oil, honey, garlic, chili powder, cumin, and season with chili flakes and salt. 3. Add the bell peppers, onion, and 1 tablespoon of olive oil - season with salt. Arrange everything evenly on the pan. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked and the peppers begin to char. 4. Meanwhile, make the vinaigrette. Toss all ingredients in a bowl and season with salt.5. Thinly slice the chicken. Serve the chicken and peppers over bowls of rice. Top the chicken with avocado and tomatoes. Add a dollop of yogurt and fresh cilantro.

recipes.title: Slow cooker citrus chicken broth with tortillas and avocado
recipes.source_note: Delicious Magazine - Mexican Recipes
recipes.description: This zingy chicken broth recipe from Charlotte Pike makes the perfect nourishing lunch on a chilly day. Let it simmer away in your slow cooker, then serve with tortillas and avocado. Charlotte says: “Sopa de lima, as it’s called in Mexico, is a wonderfully zingy yet light chicken soup. Cooking the chicken thighs with the bones in, then removing them just before serving keeps the meat juicy and tender.” Recipe taken from Quick Prep Slow Cook by Charlotte Pike (Hamlyn £16.99) and tested by d

ingredients.item: Grated zest and juice 1 pink grapefruit
2 handfuls salted tortilla chips or totopos (see Know How)

instructions.text: Put all the ingredients except the avocado, coriander and tortilla chips in the slow cooker, stir, put the lid on and cook on low for at least 4 hours until the chicken is falling apart.
Carefully remove the bones from the chicken and fish out the allspice berries. Taste the broth and add more salt or pepper if you think it needs it.
Ladle into bowls and top with the avocado, fresh coriander and tortillas/totopos.

recipes.title: Beef Soup Stock
recipes.source_note: Simple Italian Cookery (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe: Brodo di Carne

ingredients.prep_note: new carrots, or 1/2 of an old carrot

instructions.text: Boil the beef, bones, and vegetables in two quarts of water over a slow fire—adding pepper and salt. Skim occasionally, and after two hours add two tablespoons of sherry; then strain through fine soup-strainer or cheese-cloth. This is the basis of all the following soups, except when otherwise stated.
To make this stock richer, add a turkey leg to above receipt; boil one and a half hours, then add one-half a pound of finely chopped beef. Cook for half an hour longer, then strain.
To make meat jelly, add a little gelatine to the soup stock five minutes before straining.
To give a good dark color to the stock, add a few drops of "caramel," which is prepared in the following manner:

Put three tablespoons of granulated sugar into a saucepan with a little water, and until the sugar has become dark and reddish; then add a little more water and boil again until the sugar is melted. Strain and pour into a bottle when the caramel will keep perfectly for several weeks.

notes: Original Italian: Brodo di Carne

recipes.title: Rice Soup
recipes.source_note: Simple Italian Cookery (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe: Minestra di Riso

instructions.text: Cover the rice with water and boil for ten minutes; then drain and add to the stock (after it has been strained), and boil for five or ten minutes more.

notes: Original Italian: Minestra di Riso

recipes.title: Stracciatella Soup
recipes.source_note: Simple Italian Cookery (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe: Minestra di Stracciatella

instructions.text: Beat the egg, yolk and white together; add salt and the cheese, grated, and the bread crumbs; mix well together and add to the boiling stock (strained). Stir well with a fork to prevent the egg from setting, and boil for four or five minutes.

notes: Original Italian: Minestra di Stracciatella

recipes.title: Vegetable Chowder
recipes.source_note: Simple Italian Cookery (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe: Minestrone alla Milanese

ingredients.prep_note: or a ham bone 2 tomatoes, fresh or canned 1 cup of rice 2 tablespoons of dried beans 1 tablespoon of peas, fresh or canned 2 onions

instructions.text: Put into the stock the slices of pork, cut into small pieces; or, if desired, a ham bone may be substituted for the pork. Add the tomatoes, cut into small pieces also, the onions, in small pieces, and the rice. Boil all together until the rice is cooked. Then add the beans and the peas and cook a little longer. The soup is ready when it is thick. If desired, this chowder can be made with fish broth instead of the stock, and with the addition of shrimps which have been taken from their shells.
This dish can be served hot or cold.

notes: Original Italian: Minestrone alla Milanese

recipes.title: Lentil Soup
recipes.source_note: Simple Italian Cookery (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe: Brodo di Lenticchie

ingredients.item: dried lentils 1/2 tablespoon of butter 2 tablespoons of cream Meat stock

instructions.text: Cover the lentils with water and boil until they are quite soft. Pass them through a colander or a sieve. Melt the butter in a saucepan, add the lentils and cream, mixing well, then add a ladleful of the stock, and boil for a few minutes; then add the rest of the desired amount of stock, a ladleful at a time.

notes: Original Italian: Brodo di Lenticchie

recipes.title: Lettuce Soup
recipes.source_note: Simple Italian Cookery (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe: Zuppa di Lattuga

ingredients.item: lettuce Meat stock 2 potatoes The leaves of a head of celery 2 tablespoons of peas
ingredients.prep_note: fresh or canned 1 heaping tablespoon of flour

instructions.text: Put the potatoes, cold boiled, into the stock when it boils, add the celery leaves, the lettuce chopped up, the peas, and the flour mixed well with a little cold stock or water. Boil for one hour and a half, and serve with little squares of fried bread.

notes: Original Italian: Zuppa di Lattuga

missing_inputs: 1 small lettuce Meat stock 2 potatoes The leaves of a head of celery 2 tablespoons of peas

recipes.title: Pumpkin Soup
recipes.source_note: Simple Italian Cookery (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe: Zuppa di Zucca

ingredients.item: pumpkin 2 tablespoons of butter 1/2 cup of water 1-1/2 cups of milk 1 tablespoon of sugar

instructions.text: Peel the pumpkin and remove the seeds, cut into small pieces, and put into a saucepan with the butter, the sugar, a pinch of salt, and the water. Boil for two hours, then drain and put back into the saucepan with the milk, which has been boiled. Allow it to come to a boil, and then serve it with squares of fried bread.

notes: Original Italian: Zuppa di Zucca

recipes.title: Potato Soup
recipes.source_note: Simple Italian Cookery (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe: Zuppa alla Provinciale

ingredients.item: potatoes 3 tablespoons of cream or milk 2 tablespoons of butter 2 yolks of eggs Soup stock

instructions.text: Boil the potatoes, then rub them through a sieve. Put them into a saucepan with the butter, a little salt, and the cream or milk. Simmer until it is thick, then add the yolks of the two eggs to form it into a paste. Turn out onto the bread-board, cut into small dice, and throw them into the stock, which must be boiling. If desired, before serving sprinkle a little Parmesan cheese into the soup.

notes: Original Italian: Zuppa alla Provinciale

recipes.title: Corn Chowder
recipes.source_note: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe

instructions.text: Dice the bacon and put into pan to brown, add onion, celery and pepper; fry until bacon is crisp. Add the corn and saute together for 3 minutes. Add the potatoes, tomatoes and seasoning, cover and simmer for 30 minutes. Finally add the milk, heat to the boiling point and serve with a little chopped parsley.

recipes.title: Dutch Country Bean Soup
recipes.source_note: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe

instructions.text: Soak beans in water overnight. Drain, add fresh water and cook slowly with the ham bone for 2 hours. Put in the onion, celery, potatoes, tomato sauce, parsley and the salt and pepper and simmer until vegetables are soft. Remove the ham bone, trim off any meat, cut it up and add to soup. Many Pennsylvania Dutch cooks cut up hard boiled eggs and add them to the soup.

recipes.title: Split Pea Soup
recipes.source_note: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe

instructions.text: Wash peas, add cold water, vegetables and ham bone and simmer for three hours or until mixture is thick. Remove ham bone, force peas through coarse sieve and season to taste. Dilute with milk. Serve with toasted croutons.

recipes.title: Salsify Or Vegetable Oyster Soup
recipes.source_note: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe

instructions.text: Scrub, scrape and clean salsify. Dice and cook in salted water, with 1 tablespoon of vinegar added, until tender. Drain, add butter and rich milk, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil and serve with crackers.

recipes.title: Beef Soup With Dumplings
recipes.source_note: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe

instructions.text: Cook meat until tender and remove from the broth. Add water until you have 2 quarts of broth. Make dumplings by mixing beaten egg and milk into flour until about the consistency of pancake batter. Drop from teaspoon into the boiling broth to form small dumplings. Cook for 3 or 4 minutes.

recipes.title: Chicken Corn Soup
recipes.source_note: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe

instructions.text: Put cut-up chicken and onion into the water and cook slowly until tender, add salt. Remove chicken, cut the meat into small (1-inch) pieces and return to broth, together with corn, which has been cut from the cob, celery and seasoning. Continue to simmer. Make rivels by combining 1 cup flour, a pinch of salt, 1 egg and a little milk. Mix well with fork or fingers to form small crumbs. Drop these into the soup, also the chopped, hard-boiled eggs. Boil for 15 minutes longer.

recipes.title: Corn Soup With Rivels
recipes.source_note: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe

instructions.text: Cook corn in water for 10 minutes. Make a batter by mixing egg, flour and milk together. Pour this batter through a colander, letting it drop into the boiling corn. Add butter and salt. Cook slowly in a covered pan for 3 minutes. Garnish with chopped parsley. Soup should be eaten immediately after rivels are cooked.

recipes.title: Chicken Noodle Soup
recipes.source_note: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe

instructions.text: Cut a young stewing chicken into serving pieces, bring to a boil and simmer for 2½ hours, adding water as needed. Skim off the fat and add:
Bring to boil again and add noodles, preferably home made noodles. Cook for 20 minutes longer.

recipes.title: Fish Broth
recipes.source_note: Simple Italian Cookery (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe: Brodo di Pesce

ingredients.prep_note: or any other lean fish for boiling

instructions.text: Boil until fish is thoroughly cooked; strain and serve.

notes: Original: Brodo di Pesce

recipes.title: Cream Of Tomato Soup
recipes.source_note: My hundred favorite recipes (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe using Carnation Milk

instructions.text: Heat the milk and the tomato soup in different pans but at the same time, watching carefully to prevent scorching. When both are piping hot (not boiling) and you are ready to serve, pour the hot tomato into the hot Carnation and serve immediately. To avoid curdling be sure to pour the tomato into the milk instead of vice versa. Do not combine the tomato and milk until ready to serve as these should be heated separately. This makes a thick and delicious soup. Serves 4.
CARNATION MILK MAKES CREAMY SOUPS

assumptions: Serving size inferred from soups category

recipes.title: Cream Of Pea Soup
recipes.source_note: My hundred favorite recipes (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe using Carnation Milk

instructions.text: Drain and measure liquid from peas and add enough water to make 2 cups of liquid. Add peas, onion, sugar, salt, and pepper and simmer for 15 minutes. Rub through a sieve. Make a white sauce of butter, flour, and Carnation diluted with water. Add paprika. Combine pea mixture and white sauce and serve while hot. Serves 6.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from soups category

recipes.title: Cream Of Potato Soup
recipes.source_note: My hundred favorite recipes (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe using Carnation Milk

instructions.text: Cut potatoes in small pieces and cook with onion in boiling salted water until tender—use 3 cups of water and ½ teaspoon salt. Drain (saving the potato water) and rub the potatoes through a sieve. There should be about 2 cups of potato pulp. Make a white sauce of the butter, flour, seasonings, Carnation, and potato water. Add slowly to the potatoes, stirring to keep smooth. Reheat in the double boiler. Sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve very hot. Serves 6.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from soups category

recipes.title: Cream Of Celery Soup
recipes.source_note: My hundred favorite recipes (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe using Carnation Milk

instructions.text: Wash, scrape, and cut celery in ½ inch pieces; cook with slice of onion in 3 cups boiling water until celery is soft—about 30 minutes. Drain (saving the celery liquor) and rub through a sieve. Make a white sauce of the butter, flour, seasonings, Carnation, and celery liquor. Combine celery pulp and white sauce and serve while hot. Serves 6.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from soups category

recipes.title: Cream Of Mushroom Soup
recipes.source_note: My hundred favorite recipes (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe using Carnation Milk

ingredients.item: mushrooms (8-oz.) (Get can containing stems and broken pieces)

instructions.text: 1 can of mushrooms (8-oz.) (Get can containing stems and broken pieces)

Drain and measure liquor from mushrooms and add enough water to make 2 cups of liquid. Add chopped mushrooms and simmer for 15 minutes. Make white sauce of the butter, flour, seasonings, and Carnation. Add mushrooms with their liquid and serve while hot. Serves 6.

recipes.title: Oyster Stew
recipes.source_note: My hundred favorite recipes (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe using Carnation Milk

instructions.text: Carefully clean the oysters, removing any bits of shell. Heat in their own liquor until the edges curl. Season and add with butter and parsley to the 2 cups of Carnation and 2 cups of water which have been scalded together. Serves 6.
CARNATION MILK MAKES RICH SAUCES

assumptions: Serving size inferred from soups category

recipes.title: Corn Chowder
recipes.source_note: My hundred favorite recipes (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe using Carnation Milk

ingredients.item: ½ inch cube of fat salt pork

instructions.text: Cut pork into small pieces and fry out the fat; add onion and cook until brown. Strain fat into a sauce pan, add potatoes cut in ½ inch cubes, 2 cups of boiling water, and 1 tsp. salt; simmer until tender. Then add the white sauce made of the butter, flour, seasonings, and Carnation diluted with the water. Add the corn and heat the mixture to the boiling point. Place a cracker in a soup plate, dish chowder and serve immediately. Serves 10.

assumptions: Serving size inferred from soups category

recipes.title: Clam Chowder
recipes.source_note: My hundred favorite recipes (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe using Carnation Milk

ingredients.item: inch cube of fat salt pork

instructions.text: Cut pork into small pieces and fry out the fat; add onion and cook until brown. Strain fat into a sauce pan, add potatoes cut in ½ inch cubes, 1 cup of boiling water, and 1 tsp. salt; simmer until tender. Then add the white sauce made of the butter, flour, seasonings, and Carnation diluted with the water. Add the minced clams with their liquor and heat to the boiling point. Place a cracker in a soup plate, dish chowder and serve immediately. Serves 5.

recipes.title: Chicken & Andouille Smoked Sausage Gumbo
recipes.source_note: Chicken Recipes Obooko Fd0004 (PDF cookbook)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe from Chicken Recipes Obooko Fd0004

ingredients.item: Andoville saus age or Polish kielbas a in 1/4" cubes

instructions.text: Remove excess fat from chicken pieces. Rub on garlic powder and cayenne. Let stand

recipes.title: Corn Broth
recipes.source_note: Good And Cheap Obooko Fd0016 (PDF cookbook)

recipes.title: Southwestern Corn Chowder
recipes.source_note: The Chile Bible (IMG_6039)
recipes.description: A hearty corn chowder with bacon, potatoes, and green chiles.

instructions.text: Cook the bacon until crisp. Drain. Pour off all but 3 tablespoons of bacon drippings.
Add the onion and potato and cook over medium heat, stirring, until the onion is lightly browned.
Add water, cover, and simmer until the potato is just tender.
Add the corn, soup, mushrooms, milk, and salt. Heat to boiling. Lower heat, add the chiles, and simmer a few minutes.
Serve in soup bowls or a tureen. Crumble bacon on top.

recipes.title: Traditional Gazpacho
recipes.source_note: The Chile Bible (IMG_6039)
recipes.description: A classic cold Spanish soup with fresh vegetables and green chiles.

ingredients.item: onion, chopped or equivalent onion powder
cloves garlic, or equivalent garlic powder

instructions.text: Mix all the ingredients in a bowl and chill for 6 to 8 hours.
Serve with crackers or French bread.

recipes.title: Chile Gumbo
recipes.source_note: The Chile Bible (IMG_6047)
recipes.description: A hearty gumbo with salt pork, black-eyed peas, and green chiles.

instructions.text: Saute the onions and garlic with the salt pork until limp. Add the chopped tomatoes with their juice. Saute 10 minutes more.
Add the beef, stirring until it is browned.
Add the vegetable juice, okra, green chiles, and bay leaf. Cook over medium heat 45 to 60 minutes, adding water if necessary.
Then add the black-eyed peas, parsley, and more water to make a soup-like consistency. Cook 30 minutes more, stirring occasionally.
Add the salt and chile powder. Cook 10 minutes more. Stir in the file powder and cook 3 to 5 minutes only. File powder loses its effect if boiled.
Serve in large bowls or with rice.

recipes.title: French Onion Soup
recipes.source_note: French bistro classic
recipes.description: Deeply caramelized onions in rich beef broth, topped with crusty bread and melted Gruyère.

instructions.text: Melt butter with oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onions and sugar. Cook, stirring occasionally, until deeply caramelized, 45-60 minutes.
Sprinkle flour over onions and stir 2 minutes.
Add wine and scrape up browned bits. Cook until evaporated.
Add broth, thyme, and bay leaf. Simmer 30 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper. Remove thyme and bay leaf.
Preheat broiler. Ladle soup into oven-safe bowls.
Top each with bread slices and generous Gruyère.
Broil until cheese is bubbly and golden. Serve immediately.

notes: Don't rush the onion caramelization - it's the key to flavor
Swiss cheese can substitute for Gruyère

recipes.title: Cream of Cauliflower and Blue Cheese Soup
recipes.source_note: cheeseforum.org
recipes.description: Velvety smooth soup with the bold flavor of blue cheese balanced by mild cauliflower.

ingredients.item: baking potato, peeled and thinly sliced

instructions.text: Reserve 3/4 cup small cauliflower florets. Parboil 2-3 minutes, cool under cold water, set aside for garnish.
Chop remaining cauliflower.
Heat oil in large saucepan. Cook onion, garlic, and celery about 5 minutes until translucent.
Add potato, chopped cauliflower, broth, and wine. Bring to boil.
Simmer about 15 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Stir in milk and cream, heating almost to a simmer.
Stir in blue cheese a bit at a time until melted.
Blend until very smooth (immersion blender or regular blender).
Season with salt (about 1 tsp) and white pepper.
Serve in bowls garnished with reserved florets and chives.

notes: White pepper keeps soup visually appealing
Potato helps thicken and smooth the soup
Use any blue cheese - Gorgonzola, Roquefort, or Stilton
